page.title: 15Mining near Gunnislake
page.content: The{Gunnislake Clitters Mine}was started in or about 1820 for copper. The adit which cut across several lodes was eventually 3/4 mile long and more than 600 feet below surface. In 1900 the company was amalgamated with other mines in the locality of Chilsworthy/Latchley under the name of {Clitters United.}Today a group of engine houses is still standing, one close to the River Tamar with dressing floors.Above these in Clitters Wood are two arsenic stacks and the old gunnis workings.A tramway which used to link up with other mines and quarries to carry copper ore is now part of a footpath leading to Bitthams.{The proposed recovery of tin {from the waste heaps by the Company of {S.W. Minerals could create up to {40 jobs lasting approximately 2 years.
